Eupen|Eupen]]
(on loan from [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]) | clubnumber = 15 | position = [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|Defensive midfielder]] / [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|Centre back]] | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[Abuko United FC|Abuko United]] | years1 = 2010–2011 | clubs1 = [[Abuko United FC|Abuko United]] | caps1 = | goals1 = | years2 = 2011–2013 | clubs2 = [[Samger FC|Samger]] | caps2 = | goals2 = | years3 = 2013–2017 | clubs3 = [[Granada CF B|Granada B]] | caps3 = 55 | goals3 = 3 | years4 = 2014–2015 | clubs4 = [[Granada CF|Granada]] | caps4 = 1 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2017– | clubs5 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | caps5 = 0 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2017–2018 | clubs6 = → [[Real Valladolid|Valladolid]] (loan) | caps6 = 0 | goals6 = 0 | years7 = 2018 | clubs7 = → [[UD Almería|Almería]] (loan) | caps7 = 12 | goals7 = 1 | years8 = 2018– | clubs8 = → [[K.A.S. Eupen|Eupen]] (loan) | caps8 = 18 | goals8 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2011– | nationalteam1 = [[Gambia national football team|Gambia]] | nationalcaps1 = 12 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 14:10, 16 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 11 June 2017 }} '''Sulayman Marreh''' (born 15 January 1996) is a Gambian [[association football|footballer]] who plays for Belgian club [[K.A.S. Eupen|Eupen]], on loan from English club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], as a [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive midfielder]] or [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|central defender]]. ==Club career== Born in [[Banjul]], Marreh made his senior debuts with [[Abuko United FC]]. In 2011, he was spotted by [[Gambia national under-17 football team|Gambia U-17]]'s staff ahead of [[2011 African U-17 Championship]], and despite being left out of the final cut, he joined [[Samger FC]].[http://allafrica.com/stories/201309021268.html Gambia: The Day Sulayman Marreh Came of Age - Starlet Trains With Scorpions Ahead of Stars Test]; All Africa, 2 September 2013 In March 2014 he moved to [[Granada CF]] in Spain, being assigned to [[Granada CF B|the reserves]] in [[Segunda División B]], for a reported fee of one million [[Gambian dalasi|dalasi]].[http://allafrica.com/stories/201403242318.html Gambia: Sulayman Marreh Nears Granada Debut]; All Africa, 24 March 2014 Marreh made his senior debut with the side on 15 March 2014, starting in a 0–0 draw against [[FC Cartagena]];[http://granadacf.ideal.es/noticias/2014-03-15/553074-granada-desaprovecha-oportunidad-derrotar-gallito.html El Granada B desaprovecha la oportunidad de derrotar a un 'gallito' de la categoría (0–0) (Granada misses opportunity to defeat a category's top side (0–0))]; Ideal, 15 March 2014 {{es icon}} roughly a month later he netted his first goal abroad, scoring the first of a 6–1 home win over [[Écija Balompié]].[http://www.lasegundab.es/blog/2014/04/27/festin-del-granada-b-a-costa-del-ecija-26232.html Festín del Granada B a costa del Écija (Granada B's party at Écija's expense)]; La Segunda B, 27 April 2014 {{es icon}} On 21 March, Marreh was called up to the [[Andalusia]]ns' main squad ahead of the [[La Liga]] match against [[Elche CF]];[http://www.marca.com/2014/03/21/futbol/equipos/granada/1395430937.html Ighalo, principal novedad en la convocatoria del Granada (Ighalo, main news in Granada's selection)]; [[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]], 21 March 2014 {{es icon}} he remained on the bench in the 1–0 win at the ''[[Estadio Nuevo Los Cármenes]]'', however.[http://www.espnfc.com/en/report/372929/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=3888 Brahimi strike gives Granada win]; [[ESPN FC]], 22 March 2014 He made his first-team debut on 17 October, starting in a 0–1 home loss against [[Rayo Vallecano]].[http://www.espnfc.com/spanish-primera-division/match/402555/granada-rayo-vallecano/report Granada 0–1 Rayo Vallecano]; ESPN FC, 17 October 2014 On 10 July 2017, after having his federative rights assigned to [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], Marreh was loaned to [[Segunda División]] club [[Real Valladolid]] for one year.[http://www.realvalladolid.es/noticias/actualidad/10072017/Sulayman-potencia-el-centro-del-campo/ Sulayman potencia el centro del campo (Sulayman bolsters the centre of the midfield)]; Real Valladolid, 10 July 2017 {{es icon}} The following January, his loan with Valladolid was cancelled and he joined [[UD Almería]] on a loan deal for the remainder of [[2017–18 in Spanish football|the campaign]].{{Cite web | title = Iban Salvador y Sulayman Marreh abandonan el Real Valladolid | trans-title = | last = Gómez | first = Adrián | work = VAVEL.com | date = 26 January 2018 | accessdate = 1 February 2018 | url = https://www.vavel.com/es/futbol/real-valladolid/872632-iban-salvador-y-sulayman-marreh-abandonan-el-real-valladolid.html | language = es}}{{Cite web | title = Vengo a ayudar al Almería para que pueda alcanzar sus objetivos esta temporada | trans-title = | publisher = UD Almería | date = 30 January 2018 | accessdate = 1 February 2018 | url = http://www.udalmeriasad.com/noticia/vengo-a-ayudar-al-almeria-para-que-pueda-alcanzar-sus-objetivos-esta-temporada | language = es }} ==International career== After being left out of the under-17 squad, Marreh made his debut with the [[Gambia national football team|main squad]] on 9 February 2011, coming on as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in a 1–3 loss against [[Guinea-Bissau national football team|Guinea-Bissau]] at [[Lisbon]], [[Portugal]].[http://english.souslemanguier.com/nouvelles/news.asp?id=16&idnews=30451&pays=173&rub=16 The Gambia defeated by Guinea Bissau in football friendly] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140814155552/http://english.souslemanguier.com/nouvelles/news.asp?id=16&idnews=30451&pays=173&rub=16 |date=2014-08-14 }}; Sous Le Manguier, 10 February 2011 He played his first official match on 15 June of the following year, starting in a 1–4 [[2013 Africa Cup of Nations qualification]] loss against [[Algeria national football team|Algeria]].[http://www.algerie1.com/actualite/can-2013-algerie-2-gambie-0-a-la-premiere-mi-temps/ CAN 2013: Algérie 4 Gambie 1 (CAN 2013: Algeria 4 Gambia 1)] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811024246/http://www.algerie1.com/actualite/can-2013-algerie-2-gambie-0-a-la-premiere-mi-temps/ |date=2014-08-11 }}; Algérie 1, 15 June 2012 {{fr icon}} ===Statistics=== {{NFT player|id=47954|name=Sulayman Marreh|accessdate= }} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" ! colspan=3 | [[Gambia national football team|Gambia national team]] |- !Year!!Apps!!Goals |- |2011||1||0 |- |2012||1||0 |- |2013||4||0 |- |2015||4||0 |- |2017||2||0 |- !Total||10||0 |} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{BDFutbol|402409}} * {{NFT player|id=47954}} * {{Soccerway|sulayman-marreh/246647}} {{K.A.S.
